Activity: Log in to the system, check emails, and browse the company's internal documentation for the project setup guidelines and coding conventions. Skim through relevant articles about Third-Person Shooter game development.

Set up the basic project structure in the game engine (likely Unity or Unreal Engine). Create a new project with the appropriate settings for a third-person shooter. Import any necessary starter assets or plugins.
Create a basic player character model (a simple capsule or cube will suffice for prototyping). Attach a character controller component to the model.
Implement basic forward and backward movement using keyboard input (W/S keys). Focus on getting the character to move smoothly without any physics glitches.
Implement basic left and right strafing movement using keyboard input (A/D keys). Ensure that the character moves sideways relative to its current facing direction.
Implement mouse-based camera control. Allow the player to rotate the camera around the character using the mouse. Prevent camera clipping through walls.
Refactor the movement code to improve readability and maintainability. Add comments and organize the code into functions or classes.
Commit the changes to the version control system (Git). Write a descriptive commit message explaining the changes made.
